message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with natural language processing tasks such as fact extraction and verification. Additionally, the use of neural semantic matching networks suggests a focus on machine learning and artificial intelligence, making cs.AI another likely sub-category. The paper also involves information retrieval techniques, which could place it in the cs.IR (Information Retrieval) sub-category. The use of ontological WordNet features and the focus on improving semantic awareness could suggest a focus on language generation, making cs.LG (Language and Computation) another possible sub-category. Finally, the use of Pageview frequency to improve evidence retrieval results could suggest a focus on networked systems, making cs.NE (Networks and Communications) a possible sub-category as well.
